translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Avaṭa and Phala
The Elder Soṇakoṭivīsa’s Birth Story
“In the dispensation of Vipassī,
I made a cave for one;
For the Saṅgha of the four directions,
in the city of Bandhumatī.
With stones I covered the ground
of the cave and gave it away;
With uplifted mind and joy,
I made a wish at that time.
I would please the Buddha,
and I would receive the going-forth;
And I would touch the unsurpassed,
the supreme peace of Nibbāna.
Through that root of merit,
I went to the next world ninety-one times;

analyzed: deva bhūtaḥ manussaḥ ca  kata puññaḥ virocaha
translated: As a god and as a human,🔽I shone, having made merit.
Then, through the remainder of that deed,
in this my last state of existence;🔽In Campā I was born as the only son
of the foremost merchant.
When they heard that I was born,
my father’s wish was this:
‘I will give to the prince

analyzed: vīsakoṭī anūnakā  catur aṅgulā ca me lomā
translated: twenty million, not less.’🔽And on the soles of my feet
two hairs grew, four inches long;
Fine and soft to the touch,
beautiful, like a tuft of cotton-wool.
Ninety-one eons have passed,

analyzed: ayam ekaḥ ca uttari  na abhijānāmi nikkhitte
translated: This is the one and only time
That I have not put my foot down on the ground.
I have pleased the Sambuddha,🔽I have gone forth into homelessness;
I have attained the state of Worthiness,
I am cool and quenched.
I am the foremost of those who have aroused energy,
I have been pointed out by the One Who Sees All;
I am one whose pollutants are destroyed, a Worthy One,
Endowed with the six deep knowledges, with great power.
For ninety-one eons
The gift I gave then
I do not know of any bad destination,
This is the fruit of the gift of a cave.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical insights,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”
The Elder Soṇa Koṭivīsa,
at the head of the Community of monks,
When asked a question, he answered,
in the great lake Anotatta.🔽Thus spoke the venerable Elder Soṇa Koṭivīsa.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā soṇo koṭivīso thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Soṇakoṭivīsattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā soṇaḥ koṭivīsaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽soṇakoṭivīsattherassa apadānam navama
translated: The Story of the Elder Soṇa Koṭivīsa is the ninth.
